jobTitle: Healthcare HR and Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
This is a remote position.

Company Overview:

Shapely is transforming the weight loss industry through an innovative physician-led approach that makes weight loss care affordable for everyone. With evidence-based care, industry-leading support, and a seamless integrated app, we're pioneering a new approach in weight loss that helps patients achieve long-lasting, sustainable results. As we navigate our early stages, we're steadfast in our mission to help millions of Americans along their weight loss journey. Join us in shaping a company that will help improve the most important thing in all of our lives: our health.

Position Overview:

Shapely is seeking an experienced and dynamic HR and Talent Acquisition Manager to take the lead in our talent acquisition efforts while also overseeing all HR functions. This full-time role will be pivotal in driving our recruitment strategy, with a particular focus on identifying and securing top talent for key clinical roles, including physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and physicians. The ideal candidate will not only excel in talent acquisition but will also manage HR operations such as onboarding, training, payroll, time off policies, and ensuring compliance with federal and local regulations. This role requires someone who is comfortable in a start-up environment, thrives on building scalable processes, and enjoys collaborating with a dedicated team.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Recruitment and Talent Acquisition:
    • Develop and implement effective recruiting strategies to attract high-quality candidates.
    • Post job openings on various job boards and social media platforms.
    • Collaborate with leadership to understand and forecast staffing needs and requirements.
    • Utilize our applicant tracking system to track and manage candidates throughout the recruitment process.
    • Screen and vet candidates to ensure they meet the qualifications and cultural fit for Shapely.
    • Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers.
    • Maintain a pool of qualified candidates for future openings.
  • HR Functions:
    • Oversee the onboarding process to ensure new hires are successfully integrated into the company.
    • Develop and implement training programs to ensure continuous employee development.
    • Manage payroll, time off policies, and employee benefits.
    • Ensure compliance with all employment laws and company policies.
    • Develop and maintain scalable HR processes and systems.
    • Address and resolve employee HR issues.
Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as an HR Manager, Recruiting Manager, or a similar role.
  • Proven experience with hiring healthcare providers, including physicians, nurse practitioners, and physician assistants.
  • Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and HR software.
  • Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices and processes.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to build scalable HR processes in collaboration with a talented team.

Benefits

  • Full time W2 salary, including benefits
  • Remote work
  • Paid time off
  • Paid holidays
  • PPO health insurance
